musicalLanguage.description: The bossa nova standard that conquered the world. Jobim's harmonic genius disguises sophisticated jazz harmony behind a deceptively simple, swaying melody. The B section modulation — up a half step to Gb major — is one of the most elegant key changes in popular music.
musicalLanguage.structure: AABA form. A sections in F major, B section modulates to Gb then returns. 32 bars.
keyMoments: The opening A melody: a languid, syncopated line over FMaj7 that defines bossa nova
The B section modulation to Gb: the harmonic surprise that elevates the song
The return to F major: the gentle resolution back home
teachingGoals: Bossa nova rhythmic pattern — the syncopated comping feel
Chromatic voice leading through key changes
The difference between bossa nova feel and straight jazz swing
styleTips: The rhythm is everything — bossa nova has a specific syncopated pattern, not swing
Keep the touch light and even — bossa is intimate, not loud
The left hand bass pattern should be steady and hypnotic
Think of ocean waves — gentle, repetitive, mesmerizing
